text: is a Japanese city in Kagoshima Prefecture on the island of Kyushu.Deal, William E. (2005). Handbook to Life in Medieval and Early Modern Japan, p. 73. It is the capital city of the prefecture.Nussbaum, Louis-Frédéric. (2005). "Kagoshima prefecture" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 447. Kagoshima is at the southwestern tip of Kyūshū. It has been recognized as a core city since 1996.Jacobs, A.J. "Japan's Evolving Nested Municipal Hierarchy: The Race for Local Power in the 2000s," Urban Studies Research, Vol. 2011 (2011), p. 8 [PDF 8 of 14]; retrieved 2012-12-5. == History == Kagoshima was the center of Satsuma ProvinceNussbaum, "Satsuma" at p. 829. and the land of the Shimazu clan. ===Timeline=== * 1602 (Keichō 7): Shimazu build Tsurumaru castle * 1549 (Tenbun 18): Francis Xavier arrives in Japan * 1779 (An'ei 7): Sakurajima volcanic actionNussbaum, "Sakurajima" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 814. * 1863 (Bunkyū 3): Bombardment of Kyushu by British Navy * 1914 (Taishō 3): Sakurajima erupts *2013 Sakurajima erupts. == References == == Other websites == * Kagoshima Prefectural Visitors Bureau * http://www.city.kagoshima.lg.jp/_1010/shimin/foreigner.html ; * Kagoshima Internationalization Council * Category:Cities in Kagoshima Prefecture
